this is PAL, not NTSC. the screen rolled & color was black & white, so i converted it to ntsc with a program called pal2ntsc .  a tiny part of the bottom of the screen is cut off which happens with most PAL converted games but the text/subtitles are still readable.

you can get pal2ntsc thru warez-bb
check the "make PN selector" box when patching the iso

menus and important text is translated. original character voices.

the game runs PAL video. to play it without hacks, you need a TV set that supports PAL.

PS2 is different from older consoles. All region PS2 systems are capable of any video mode. The only reason most NTSC users don't encounter PAL, is no NTSC region coded games request it.
